summary: This document is an email chain between law enforcement officials discussing the rescheduling of an interview with 'Mullen' and the review of a draft affidavit for an amended search warrant for drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. It shows coordination between the NYPD and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in the investigation.

persons.name: Paul
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding the review of a draft affidavit for an amended search warrant for drives from Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Mullen
persons.context: An interview with Mullen is being rescheduled to a different day in the same week as the email correspondence.

connections.description: Paul is asked to reach out to Mullen to reschedule an interview, indicating Mullen is a subject of investigative interest.

events.title: Planned warrant focus day
events.description: Law enforcement officials plan to focus on the search warrant application the day after the email.

events.title: Draft affidavit submission
events.description: A draft affidavit in support of an amended search warrant for drives from Epstein's NY residence was sent for review.

keyFacts: Three drives were seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, requiring an amended search warrant.
An interview with a person named Mullen was being rescheduled to allow focus on the warrant application.
The correspondence involves coordination between the NYPD and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The email chain dates from October 22 to October 25, 2020, during the post-arrest investigation phase.
The document indicates ongoing investigative steps regarding digital evidence from Epstein's property.
